H0.text: Diffraction of light is what a scanning electron microscope is best suited for observing.

H1.text: Tectonic features on planets are best observed using a scanning electron microscope.

H2.text: The surfaces of small objects are best observed using a scanning electron microscope.

H3.text: Topographical features on the ocean floor are best observed by a scanning electron microscope.

A4.text: Some SEMs can achieve resolutions better than 1 nanometer.

A5.text: A scanning electron microscope (SEM) is a type of electron microscope that produces images of a sample by scanning the surface with a focused beam of electrons.
